title: If I claim bankruptcy for the 3rd time will I go to jail?
question: Drowned in credit card debt due to not making ends meet living check to check
answers:
No, you won't go to jail. There is no "3 Strikes" law for filing bankruptcy. Also, bankruptcy is not a criminal proceeding. It is a consumer remedy, which explains why you did not have to face jail time for the first 2 bankruptcy cases. The law firm where I work has handled several cases for clients where were filing bankruptcy for their 4th time!

However, there are time restrictions for filing repeat bankruptcy cases. You have to wait a certain amount of time after filing before you can file again. A good local bankruptcy lawyer will explain the rules for you and help you determine what you may be eligible to file at this time.

Good luck to you.

You can't go to jail for filing bankruptcy. Whether you can file for bankruptcy for a third time depends on when you filed previously and what chapter you filed. You have to wait eight years after a previous chapter 7 discharge, for example, to file again. Consult with an experienced bankruptcy attorney in your area to formulate the right strategy for you. Most offer free consults. Good luck.

You can file a Chapter 7 if eight years have passed since the day you filed your last Chapter 7, or six years after your last Chapter 13. You never have to worry about going to jail, as long as you tell the truth in your bankruptcies! There are certain things one can do with the help of a good, experienced Bankruptcy lawyer, so why not find a local attorney by using the above "Find a lawyer" tab. You can also find an experienced attorney in your area by looking at the National Assn. of Consumer Bankruptcy Attorneys website, at www.nacba.org. God Bless you! You do not need to live in uncertainty! it's a terrible state to live in.
You won't go to jail no matter how many times you file bankruptcy. Now you can' go to jail for bankruptcy fraud, but that's a different matter.
